programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Journeys in Japan
programme.sub-title: With Isabella Bird - Part 7: On the Road to Ise
programme.desc: British explorer and writer Isabella Bird arrived in Japan in 1878, just 10 years after start of the Meiji Era. "Unbeaten Tracks in Japan" is her highly praised account of her journey deep into Japan's hinterland. After traveling from Yokohama all the way up to Hokkaido, Bird then made her way to Kansai, where she visited Kyoto, Nara and Mie Prefectures. As a student, Rachael Aoki studied in Kyoto at a university that Isabella visited during her stay. In this episode, Rachael retraces Bird's steps from the Nara deer park to the Ise Jingu Shrine, with a stop at Hasedera Temple en route.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: GRAND SUMO Highlights
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN presents a sumo highlights program for fans around the globe. Today the show features all top-division bouts from January 13, Day 3 of the Grand Sumo Tournament in Tokyo.

programme.title: Sumopedia
programme.desc: Sumopedia enriches your sumo experience with information on the techniques, traditions and famous wrestlers of the past. The rules may be simple but there is a lot more to sumo than meets the eye.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Dining with the Chef
programme.sub-title: Rika's TOKYO CUISINE: Kushi-age Party - Deep-Fried Skewers
programme.desc: Kushi-age is a dish where various ingredients are skewered, coated in batter and deep-fried. Rika prepares each ingredient differently, and adds a twist with a unique sauce, for diverse flavors.

programme.title: NEWSROOM TOKYO
programme.desc: NEWSROOM TOKYO dives deeper into the day's news with insight and analysis, from the perspective of Japan and the rest of Asia. We put a spotlight on what you need to know to understand the issues.

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.desc: Since 2021, Yoshida Hirofumi has been principal guest conductor of the Odesa National Academic Opera and Ballet Theater in Ukraine. He talks about what he hopes to convey through music amid conflict.

programme.title: JAPAN DELISH
programme.desc: Crisp, hot and delicious Japanese gyoza! How did gyoza come to be so beloved in Japan? Taste the delicious truth for yourself!

programme.title: Framing Everyday Moments
programme.desc: Kyoto Night Lights, Skies Over Sapporo, Tokyo Tilt Shift, Synchronous Scenes (Taiwan), Slices of the Starry Sky (Tottori), Lanes of Light (Osaka), Haneda Night Parade (Tokyo), Full Moon Over the Metropolis (Tokyo)

programme.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE
programme.desc: In the Edo period, childbirth was a community affair, with the mother-to-be attended by a midwife and the women in her life. It was also characterized by unique customs and superstitions. *"The Birth of the First Child" sheet 7 of the series "Marriage in Brocade Prints, the Carriage of the Virtuous Woman, known as the Marriage series" (c.1769) by Suzuki Harunobu

programme.title: Japan in Focus
programme.sub-title: Every Second Counts: Flying Rescue Unit ARROWS
programme.desc: Operating helicopters, members of ARROWS (Airborne Rescue & Relief Operations With Search) race around Japan to provide emergency support following major disasters.

programme.title: Document 72 Hours
programme.sub-title: A Winding Road Through the Kii Mountains
programme.desc: A national road winds through a rugged mountain range on the Kii Peninsula. We drove the length of this road over three days to meet some of the residents in this remote region.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Science View
programme.sub-title: Revolution in Air Travel! The Cutting Edge of Flying Car Technology
programme.desc: The global race to develop flying cars is heating up, with Japan leading in key parts like batteries and motors. The revolution in air travel is here!

programme.sub-title: Haneda - Memories of Sky and Sea

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.sub-title: Marvelous Marmalade from Japan: Enami Noriyuki / Citrus Farmer, Marmalade Artisan
programme.desc: Enami Noriyuki won the coveted Double Gold Award at the world's most prestigious marmalade-making competition in 2020 and 2022. He talks about the secrets of his craft and his tumultuous journey.

programme.title: Japan's Top Inventions
programme.desc: Discover the stories behind renowned Japanese products alongside our reporter. This time: Water Jet Cutters.

programme.title: FRONTRUNNERS
programme.desc: Social entrepreneur Ishikawa Naohito creates opportunities for Sri Lankans to enrich their lives. Projects include a massage salon employing the visually impaired, and an organic vegetable business.

programme.title: NHK NEWS 7
programme.desc: News 7 is NHK's flagship domestic evening news program, bringing you the latest from our Tokyo studio. It's presented with English audio on NHK World for our international viewers

programme.title: Dive in Tokyo
programme.sub-title: Haneda - Memories of Sky and Sea
programme.desc: Join us as we explore the Haneda district, best known for its airport. As we trace its history, we learn about its past as a fishing community and tourist destination famous for its ocean views.

programme.title: NEWSROOM TOKYO
programme.desc: NEWSROOM TOKYO dives deeper into the day's news with insight and analysis, from the perspective of Japan and the rest of Asia. We put a spotlight on what you need to know to understand the issues.

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.desc: Sekiguchi Itaru helped to restore the pipe organ at Notre Dame in Paris, following the cathedral's fire in 2019. He tells us about his work, including the tuning and voicing of these instruments.

programme.title: JAPAN DELISH
programme.desc: Japanese festival favorite, yakisoba! Noodles cooked in a special sauce. Enjoy local yakisoba from all over Japan!

programme.title: Framing Everyday Moments
programme.desc: As most of Japan sleeps, factories across the country work through the night to keep the wheels of industry turning. Filmed by photographer Tetsuro Kobayashi.

programme.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE
programme.desc: A group of anglers stand in a fast-moving, undulating river at the foot of a rugged cliff. They use "drifting mosquito hooks" to fish for a summer delicacy that was a favorite of the Edo townspeople. *"Fly-fishing" from the series "One Thousand Pictures of the Ocean" (c.1833) by Katsushika Hokusai

programme.title: NEWSROOM TOKYO
programme.desc: NEWSROOM TOKYO dives deeper into the day's news with insight and analysis, from the perspective of Japan and the rest of Asia. We put a spotlight on what you need to know to understand the issues.

programme.sub-title: Marvelous Marmalade from Japan: Enami Noriyuki / Citrus Farmer, Marmalade Artisan

programme.title: FRONTRUNNERS

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Trails to Oishii Tokyo
programme.desc: Known to the world as panko, Japanese breadcrumbs are made by breaking apart fresh loaves of bread. Experience Japan's crunchy, juicy and truly unique fried food culture. (Reporter: Kailene Falls)

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: The World Heritage Sites in Japan
programme.sub-title: Triangular Roofs Bring People Together: Historic Villages of Shirakawa-go and Gokayama
programme.desc: Shirakawa-go in Gifu Prefecture is one of Japan's snowiest regions. It's famous for its traditional thatched-roof Gassho-style homes. The triangular roofs distribute the weight of heavy snow evenly, and the steep slopes allow residents to remove snow with little effort. Hearth fires provide heat that dries out thatch and soot that blackens pillars and beams. These homes have lasted for so long because they are still inhabited. The cooperative bond between residents is a key part of life here and is essential when rethatching these homes. Come and visit a mountain village that appears to be frozen in time.

programme.title: Preparation
programme.sub-title: #1 The Doctor's Office Doesn't Scare Me!
programme.desc: Luna has a slight fever so Daddy takes her to the doctor. Luna is not happy, but when the doctor introduces Preppy, a strange creature, she is delighted! With Preppy's help, the doctor gently explains how Luna's examination will go. Luna comes to understand why it is important to go to the hospital.

programme.title: Where We Call Home
programme.sub-title: Supporting Afghan Women with Rugs Handwoven
programme.desc: We meet Ashraf Baburi in Chiba Prefecture who provides work to women in his native Afghanistan by importing traditional rugs they weave, and French-born Stephane Danton who runs a tea store in Tokyo.

programme.title: Time-lapse Japan
programme.desc: *First broadcast on January 12, 2026 Locals in Hagi, on a delta facing the Sea of Japan, have lived in harmony with its waters. Beautiful time-lapse footage captures people crossing rivers by boat and canals flowing into homes.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: CINEMATIC JOURNEY
programme.desc: Kyle Card hikes along the 1,000km trail following the Pacific Coast in northern Japan, where he discovers local lifestyles, stunning nature, traces of the area's 2011 disaster, and resilient people.

programme.title: Time-lapse Japan
programme.desc: Since ancient times, safflowers grown in Yonezawa have been used to dye fabric a deep red color associated with the sun. Experience its mysterious, vivid beauty through time-lapse footage.

programme.title: GRAND SUMO Highlights
programme.desc: NHK WORLD-JAPAN presents a sumo highlights program for fans around the globe. Today the show features all top-division bouts from January 12, Day 2 of the Grand Sumo Tournament in Tokyo.

programme.title: Sumopedia
programme.desc: Sumopedia enriches your sumo experience with information on the techniques, traditions and famous wrestlers of the past. The rules may be simple but there is a lot more to sumo than meets the eye.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Nun's Seasonal Calendar
programme.desc: Join us as we learn about life at the Otowasan Kannonji Temple through 24 terms from the solar calendar. On the winter date of Shokan, the nuns pick herbs in the temple's garden and make seasonal rice porridge. Then, we follow them on Daikan as they prepare kan-koji fermented rice and pickled napa cabbage. They also make a variety of winter dishes using dried vegetables.

programme.title: One in Every Japanese
programme.desc: 1 in 2 don't drink in Japan, where intense social drinking is normal. Through interviews of drinkers and non-drinkers we hear both sides, including a couple who went sober and opened a no-alcohol bar.

programme.title: Preparation
programme.desc: Luna insists that she doesn't want to take bitter medicine that she doesn't like the look of. Thanks to the doctor's mysterious powers, a group of prince-like boys appear in front of her and introduce themselves as "Powders," "Pills" and "Capsules." One by one, they explain to Luna why medicine is bitter and why it looks the way it does. Feeling excited, Luna decides to take her medicine without hesitation next time.

programme.title: Magical Japanese
programme.desc: Written Japanese was developed and refined after Japan began using Chinese kanji characters in the early 5th century. This history is reflected in the many words related to kaku, or "to write."

programme.title: Easy Japanese
programme.desc: To introduce someone to someone else, say a word to explain the relationship, followed by "no" and then the person's name and "desu".

programme.title: Culture Crossroads
programme.desc: 'The fact that foreign collectors cherish Japanese swords helps to unearth ancient works taken overseas after 1945. It also serves as a force for preserving traditional techniques facing extinction.

programme.title: HELLO! NHK WORLD-JAPAN
programme.desc: We introduce a lineup of programs conveying Japan's unique perspectives and cultural practices. Themes include falconry, etiquette, and the National Museum of Japanese History.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: MATSURI: The Heartbeat of Japan
programme.desc: Gojinjo Taiko is a wild, powerful performance by masked drummers. It originated 400 years ago in the small coastal community of Nafune-machi in Ishikawa Prefecture. The story goes that, faced with an imminent attack by a powerful warlord, villagers used improvised masks to disguise themselves as oni (demons), and scared away the approaching forces. Gojinjo Taiko is performed not only at the summer matsuri (festival) but at local hotels in everyday life, as a form of community revitalization.

programme.title: JAPAN DELISH
programme.desc: "Curry rice," one of Japan's most iconic national dishes. How did Jimbocho, Tokyo become a curry town?

programme.title: The Masterpieces of Ukiyo-e producer Tsutaju
programme.desc: This miniseries presents the masterpieces of Tsutaju, a brilliant ukiyo-e producer of the Edo period. This episode takes a close look at artist Utamaro's iconic "Woman with a Glass Noisemaker."

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.sub-title: Picture Books for Children and Adults Alike
programme.desc: In 2024, Miyakoshi Akiko won a New York Times' Best Illustrated Children's Book Award. We see how she creates art, using charcoal and watercolors. And we discover the inspiration behind her work.

programme.title: Trails to Oishii Tokyo
programme.desc: Shiitake the star Japanese mushroom known for its strong umami. Visit a farmer who uses centuries-old cultivation methods to conserve the natural surroundings, then head over to our reporter's hometown in Sweden to see how shiitake have grown in popularity overseas. We'll be cooking up all kinds of mushroom dishes, from Scandinavian to French to Japanese. (Reporter: Janni Olsson)

programme.title: Framing Everyday Moments
programme.desc: Mt. Fuji Among the Clouds (Shizuoka), Seto Inland Sea Scenes (Okayama), Where Heaven and Earth Meet (Nara), Sunbeam Shower (Gifu), Lake Biwa Sunset (Shiga), Fishing Torches Dance (Tokushima), A Night on Mt. Tsukuba (Ibaraki), Sparkling Miracle Night (Hiroshima Pref.)

programme.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE
programme.desc: Workers at a sawmill use the latest tools and their honed skills to prepare the building blocks of Edo life: long, narrow beams, bamboo stems and leftover wood stacked as high as buildings. *"Tatekawa in Honjo" from the series "Thirty-six Views of Mount Fuji" (c.1830) by Katsushika Hokusai

programme.title: Japan in Focus
programme.sub-title: The Realities of Non-Profits after the Noto Earthquake
programme.desc: Hard-earned experience has made nonprofit organizations invaluable partners in disaster recovery. Japan's government is now moving toward formalizing their role.

programme.title: Seasoning the Seasons
programme.desc: Today in Japan, the Jomon period is experiencing a quiet boom. Jomon is a unique Japanese culture that lasted approximately 13,000 years in the pre-Christian age, within the Mesolithic and Neolithic periods in world history. It was a time when pit-buildings, pottery, and bows and arrows started to be used. Jomon ruins found throughout Japan number up to 90,000 locations. We go on a journey all over Japan to discover Jomon culture that is still alive.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: The World Heritage Sites in Japan
programme.sub-title: Triangular Roofs Bring People Together: Historic Villages of Shirakawa-go and Gokayama
programme.desc: Shirakawa-go in Gifu Prefecture is one of Japan's snowiest regions. It's famous for its traditional thatched-roof Gassho-style homes. The triangular roofs distribute the weight of heavy snow evenly, and the steep slopes allow residents to remove snow with little effort. Hearth fires provide heat that dries out thatch and soot that blackens pillars and beams. These homes have lasted for so long because they are still inhabited. The cooperative bond between residents is a key part of life here and is essential when rethatching these homes. Come and visit a mountain village that appears to be frozen in time.

programme.title: Medical Frontiers
programme.sub-title: New Ways to Slow Alzheimer's Disease
programme.desc: Two drugs have been approved for their potential to slow the progression of Alzheimer's disease. We look at how they work and report on new findings suggesting a food-derived component may also help.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Herbal Symphony
programme.desc: Summer in Japan's oldest private medicinal herb garden in Uda, Nara Prefecture and the herbs are in full bloom. The herbs protect people's health and are used to create beautiful dyes.

programme.title: Time-lapse Journey
programme.desc: Mt. Fuji is the tallest mountain in Japan. Its beauty has many faces: the Fuji that's painted in the warm hues of the morning sun, or the glimmering peak during the moment the sun crosses the summit. At night, the mountain is lit up by climbers. See these different Fujis through time-lapse photography.

programme.title: Where We Call Home
programme.sub-title: Supporting Afghan Women with Rugs Handwoven
programme.desc: We meet Ashraf Baburi in Chiba Prefecture who provides work to women in his native Afghanistan by importing traditional rugs they weave, and French-born Stephane Danton who runs a tea store in Tokyo.

programme.title: Time-lapse Japan
programme.desc: *First broadcast on January 12, 2026 Locals in Hagi, on a delta facing the Sea of Japan, have lived in harmony with its waters. Beautiful time-lapse footage captures people crossing rivers by boat and canals flowing into homes.

Gojinjo Taiko is performed not only at the summer matsuri (festival) but at local hotels in everyday life, as a form of community revitalization.

programme.title: Nun's Cookbook
programme.desc: Seasonal recipes from the nuns of Otowasan Kannonji Temple: Furofuki daikon with two sauces. First, prepare the sauces using a white miso base, one with boiled butterbur and the other with yuzu peel and juice. Serve with boiled daikon for a crispy spring treat.

programme.title: Journeys in Japan
programme.sub-title: With Isabella Bird - Part 7: On the Road to Ise
programme.desc: British explorer and writer Isabella Bird arrived in Japan in 1878, just 10 years after start of the Meiji Era. "Unbeaten Tracks in Japan" is her highly praised account of her journey deep into Japan's hinterland. After traveling from Yokohama all the way up to Hokkaido, Bird then made her way to Kansai, where she visited Kyoto, Nara and Mie Prefectures. As a student, Rachael Aoki studied in Kyoto at a university that Isabella visited during her stay. In this episode, Rachael retraces Bird's steps from the Nara deer park to the Ise Jingu Shrine, with a stop at Hasedera Temple en route.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Herbal Symphony
programme.desc: Summer in Japan's oldest private medicinal herb garden in Uda, Nara Prefecture and the herbs are in full bloom. The herbs protect people's health and are used to create beautiful dyes.

programme.title: Time-lapse Journey
programme.desc: Mt. Fuji is the tallest mountain in Japan. Its beauty has many faces: the Fuji that's painted in the warm hues of the morning sun, or the glimmering peak during the moment the sun crosses the summit. At night, the mountain is lit up by climbers. See these different Fujis through time-lapse photography.

programme.title: Dining with the Chef
programme.sub-title: Rika's TOKYO CUISINE: Kushi-age Party - Deep-Fried Skewers
programme.desc: Kushi-age is a dish where various ingredients are skewered, coated in batter and deep-fried. Rika prepares each ingredient differently, and adds a twist with a unique sauce, for diverse flavors.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Document 72 Hours
programme.sub-title: A Winding Road Through the Kii Mountains
programme.desc: A national road winds through a rugged mountain range on the Kii Peninsula. We drove the length of this road over three days to meet some of the residents in this remote region.

programme.title: NHK NEWSLINE
programme.desc: NHK NEWSLINE brings you up to date with the latest from Japan, Asia and around the world. Our team covers breaking news and major developments, with trusted anchors to tie it all together.

programme.title: Medical Frontiers
programme.sub-title: New Ways to Slow Alzheimer's Disease
programme.desc: Two drugs have been approved for their potential to slow the progression of Alzheimer's disease. We look at how they work and report on new findings suggesting a food-derived component may also help.

programme.title: Sumopedia
programme.desc: Sumopedia enriches your sumo experience with information on the techniques, traditions and famous wrestlers of the past. The rules may be simple but there is a lot more to sumo than meets the eye.

programme.title: NEWSROOM TOKYO
programme.desc: NEWSROOM TOKYO dives deeper into the day's news with insight and analysis, from the perspective of Japan and the rest of Asia. We put a spotlight on what you need to know to understand the issues.

programme.title: Direct Talk
programme.desc: Since 2021, Yoshida Hirofumi has been principal guest conductor of the Odesa National Academic Opera and Ballet Theater in Ukraine. He talks about what he hopes to convey through music amid conflict.

programme.title: JAPAN DELISH
programme.desc: Crisp, hot and delicious Japanese gyoza! How did gyoza come to be so beloved in Japan? Taste the delicious truth for yourself!

programme.title: Framing Everyday Moments
programme.desc: Kyoto Night Lights, Skies Over Sapporo, Tokyo Tilt Shift, Synchronous Scenes (Taiwan), Slices of the Starry Sky (Tottori), Lanes of Light (Osaka), Haneda Night Parade (Tokyo), Full Moon Over the Metropolis (Tokyo)

programme.title: Ukiyoe EDO-LIFE
programme.desc: In the Edo period, childbirth was a community affair, with the mother-to-be attended by a midwife and the women in her life. It was also characterized by unique customs and superstitions. *"The Birth of the First Child" sheet 7 of the series "Marriage in Brocade Prints, the Carriage of the Virtuous Woman, known as the Marriage series" (c.1769) by Suzuki Harunobu

programme.title: Science View
programme.sub-title: Revolution in Air Travel! The Cutting Edge of Flying Car Technology
programme.desc: The global race to develop flying cars is heating up, with Japan leading in key parts like batteries and motors. The revolution in air travel is here!
